cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 45 mi (75 km) SE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest toward the central Texas coast today, then expected to slow, turn north Tuesday, and arc northeast along the upper Texas/lower Louisiana coast through mid-week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast near Port O’Connor–Matagorda Peninsula

weather_observation.watch_coast: Baffin Bay to Port Aransas, TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas, TX to Morgan City, LA (including San Antonio, Matagorda & Galveston Bays)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and upper Texas coastline from Corpus Christi/Port Aransas through Sabine Pass and adjacent bays
weather_observation.wind: Sustained tropical-storm-force winds of 40-50 mph with higher gusts expected Monday afternoon through early Tuesday; gradual weakening thereafter.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible in San Antonio Bay/Matagorda Bay, including Calhoun Port facilities.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches with isolated 15 inches possible through Wednesday; flash and urban flooding likely.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf/rip currents, minor river flooding, and an isolated tornado threat in rain bands.
